{"step_by_step_thinking": "Binder syndrome, also known as maxillonasal dysplasia, is characterized by several distinct features. According to Document [0], it is characterized by nasomaxillary hypoplasia, which can result in a flat nasal bridge, as mentioned in Document [2] and Document [16]. This rules out option B. Document [4] and Document [16] mention that a Class III malocclusion is common in Binder syndrome, ruling out option C. Document [1] and Document [25] also mention that Binder syndrome often presents with acute naso-labial angle, ruling out option A. Therefore, the feature that is not characteristic of Binder syndrome is a Class II malocclusion.", "answer_choice": "D"}
